CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Post-sale Survey stage positioned above or below the Contract Signed stage?
SRP.A: The Post-sale Survey stage is positioned {below} the Contract Signed stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Sale Closed?
VE.A: The value of stage Sale Closed is {76}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Post-sale Survey?
VE.A: The value of stage Post-sale Survey is {67}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Negotiation, with a value of {371}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Post-sale Survey, with a value of {67}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Sale Closed to stage Post-sale Survey?
SC.A: Decreased by {9} Properties from stage Sale Closed to stage Post-sale Survey.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 130? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Negotiation} stage has {371}, the {Contract Signed} stage has {185}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 278? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Contract Signed} stage has {185}, the {Sale Closed} stage has {76}, the {Post-sale Survey} stage has {67}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 33 and 278? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Contract Signed} stage has {185}, the {Sale Closed} stage has {76}, the {Post-sale Survey} stage has {67}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Contract Signed to Sale Closed, or from stage Sale Closed to Post-sale Survey?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Contract Signed} to {Sale Closed} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Contract Signed to Sale Closed, from stage Negotiation to Contract Signed, or from stage Sale Closed to Post-sale Survey?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Negotiation} to stage {Contract Signed} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Negotiation} and {Contract Signed} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Sale Closed} and {Post-sale Survey} stages.
